intro: Saurauia leoi, commonly known as the Sierra Leone starapple, is a member of the Ericaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of West Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a fleshy, star-shaped berry that is edible and has a sweet, acidic flavor. Saurauia leoi is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
